# R Markdown

R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars)
fit
```

# Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure \@ref(fig:bar) for example:

```{r bar, fig.cap='A fancy bar chart.', tidy = FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = cut)) + geom_bar()
```
